citeinfo.title: Chesapeake Bay-Maryland National Estuarine Research Reserve Boundaries
citeinfo.othercit: NERR means National Esturaine Reseach Reserve.

descript.abstract:
The National Estuarine Research Reserve System is a network of protected areas established for long-term research, education and stewardship. This partnership program between NOAA and the coastal states protects more than one million acres of estuarine land and water, which provides essential habitat for wildlife; offers educational opportunities for students, teachers and the public; and serves as living laboratories for scientists.
The original project areas were drawn on SPOT 10-meter panchromatic imagery. They were drawn by Ken Miller and verified by the Maryland NERR coordinator, Carol Towle. Using the source maps as a rough guide, the lines were redrawn using an ArcView 3.2 platform.
In 2007, the boundary was updated to comply with the requirements of the National Estuarine Research Reserve Program in splitting the reserve into a core area and buffer zone. Areas designated as core are defined as areas of limited future disturbance that would affect the ecological integrity of the reserve. Areas being designated as buffer are those areas that protect the core. At the Chesapeake Bay - Marylands Reserves, the core area is designated as open water, tidal wetlands, and non-tidal in holdings, and the buffer will be those areas designated as woodland and non-tidal wetlands.
This process was done by MD Department of Natural Resources at a scale of 12,000, and wetlands were intersected with the boundaries to delineate the tidal vs. non-tidal boundaries for Otter Point Creek and Jug Bay. Note: in keeping with the separation of core and buffer non-tidal dikes and islands were removed from the core. Now Monie Bay, being completely tidal in mature, had to be delineated using best user judgment. And lastly, boundaries were separated by Maryland's Political County Boundaries to identify separations in ownerships.
First off, the Otter Point Creek and the Jug Bay sites were expanded to incorporate recent property acquisitions. These boundaries, originally digitized over tax map boundaries for property acquisition assessment, were added. Otter Point Creek had just a small expansion of a couple of parcels. However, Jug Bay was expanded considerably to encompass the Glendening Preserve and some other properties to the east acquired by Anne Arundel County.
descript.purpose: Three of the National Estuarine Research Reserve (NERR) Sites are located in Maryland. They are: Otter Point Creek along the Bush River in Harford County, Jug Bay Wetlands Sanctuary in Anne Arundel and Prince George's Counties, and Monie bay in Somerset County. The project area boundaries were created to assist in planning and data collection operations.

idinfo.native: This data have been produced over a periode of time using ARC/INFO and TNTmips software products on personal computer platforms. Due to the length of the project, multiple versions of each software package have been used. Final editing and data conversion were accomplished using TNTmips versions 7.1 and ARC/View Version 9.1

attracc.attraccr: All attributes were checked over their native data sets.

dataqual.logic: All polygons are closed. Polygons do not overlap.

horizpa.horizpar: The original polygons were digitized on SPOT 10-meter panchromatic imagery. Those polygons are an approximation of the area in which to acquire aerial photography. The expansion areas were digitized over underlying tax map boundaries.

citeinfo.title: doqnerr - NERR Project Areas
citeinfo.othercit: NERR means National Esturaine Reseach Reserve.

srcinfo.srccontr: The general project area was hand drawn on the SPOT imagery.

pubinfo.publish: Maryland Department of Natural Resources - Geographic Information Services Division

procstep.procdesc: The original project areas were drawn on SPOT 10-meter panchromatic imagery. They were drawn by Ken Miller and verified by the Maryland NERR coordinator, Carol Towle. Using the source maps as a rough guide, the lines were redrawn using an ArcView 3.2 platform.

cntaddr.address: Tawes State Office Building 580 Taylor Avenue, E-2

procstep.procdesc: Several process steps and data sets went into updating the NERR Boundaries since their original creation over the 10-meter panchromatic imagery. First off, the Otter Point Creek and the Jug Bay sites were expanded to incorporate recent property acquisitions. These boundaries, originally digitized over tax map boundaries for property acquisition assessment, were added. Otter Point Creek had just a small expansion of a couple of parcels. However, Jug Bay was expanded considerably to encompass the Glendening Preserve and some other properties to the east acquired by Anne Arundel County. Now as per the requirements of the National Estuarine Research Reserve Program each reserve was split up into what they designate as Core and Buffer Areas. Areas designated as core being defined as areas of limited future disturbance that would affect the ecological integrity of the reserve. Areas being designated as buffer as those areas that protect the core. Therefore for the purpose of defining core and buffer for Maryland's Reserves, core will be those areas designated as open water, tidal wetlands, and non-tidal in holdings and buffer will be those areas designated as woodland and non-tidal wetlands. For this the DNR 12,000 scale wetlands were intersected with the boundaries to delineate the tidal vs. non-tidal boundaries for Otter Point Creek and Jug Bay. Note: in keeping with the separation of core and buffer non-tidal dikes and islands were removed from the core. Now Monie Bay, being completely tidal in mature, had to be delineated using best user judgment. And lastly, boundaries were separated by Maryland's Political County Boundaries to identify separations in ownerships.

cntaddr.address: Tawes State Office Building 580 Taylor Avenue, E-2

edom.edomvd: Areas that are least disturbed areas where no future disturbance should occur that would affect the ecological integrity of the reserve.
areas that protect the core area; they are normally relatively undisturbed places.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
Otter Point Creek Monie Bay Jug Bay

Core - Tidal Wetlands, Open Water, and Nontidal Inholding. Buffer - Woodland and Nontidal Wetlands.
Note: this field has been left blank for Monie Bay because both core and buffer areas are tidal wetlands.

overview.eaover: Attributes were assigned based upon the reference layers and the reserve designations.
